p: Smyrnium olusatrum L. (Apiaceae) is characterized by oxygenated sesquiterpenes containing a furan ring. In the work of Petrelli et al. 2017 [ 55], the T. brucei inhibitory activities of the essential oils obtained from different organs and of the main oxygenated sesquiterpenes, such as isofuranediene, germacrone and β-acetoxifuranoeudesm-4-ene, were explored. All oils inhibited the growth of the parasite, showing IC 50 values of 1.9–4.0 µg/mL; isofuranediene exhibited significant and selective inhibitory activity against T. brucei (IC 50 of 0.6 μg/mL, SI = 30), with β-acetoxifuranoeudesm-4-ene giving a moderate potentiating effect.
